a1: A UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) is a 128-bit identifier that is practically unique across all systems. Version 4 UUIDs are randomly generated.
a2: The probability of generating a duplicate UUID v4 is astronomically low â€” about 1 in 5.3 x 10^36.
a3: Yes, you can generate up to 100 UUIDs at once and copy them all with one click.
